data.name: Frequency of a digit in a range taking only the prime numbers
data.description:
Given an array A of random positive numbers, and an array of queries [L, R, X], indicate for that range (R inclusive) the frequency of the digit X only taken the prime numbers.
L: left bound, R: right bound (0-based), T: target digit.
Constraints:
1 <= A.Length <= 1000000
0 <= A[i] <= 10000000
1 <= queries.Length <= 2000
A = {4159, 5449, 4000, 6311, 7817, 66666, 8059, 10000, 6977, 8111, 4000 }
Queries = {[1, 5, 4], [5, 9, 6], [5, 5, 7], [0, 10, 0]}
For query [1, 5, 4]:
Left index: 1
Right index: 5
Target digit: 4
A[1,5] = {5449, 4000, 6311, 7817, 66666}
Primes in A[1,5] = {5449, 6311, 7817}
Answer = 2 (digit 4 is present in 5449 two times).
For query [5, 9, 6]:
Left index: 5
Right index: 9
Target digit: 6
A[5,9] = {66666, 8059, 10000, 6977, 8111}
Primes in A[5,9] = {8059, 6977, 8111}
Answer = 1 (6 is present one time in 6977).
For query [5, 5, 7]:
Left index: 5
Right index: 5
Target digit: 7
A[5,5] = {66666}
Primes in A[5,5] = {}
Therefore, answer = 0
For query [0, 10, 0]:
Left index: 0
Right index: 10
Target digit: 0
A[0, 10] = {4159, 5449, 4000, 6311, 7817, 66666, 8059, 10000, 6977, 8111, 4000 }
Primes in A[0, 10] = {4159, 5449, 6311, 7817, 8059, 6977, 8111}
Answer = 1 (digit 0 is present one time in 8059)
